meanings.definition: A person who pretends to be someone they are not.
meanings.sent1: The poser at school always claimed to have been to exotic places.
meanings.sent2: She could tell he was a poser because his stories never added up.
meanings.sent3: The poser tried to impress everyone with fake stories about meeting celebrities.
meanings.sent4: The detective quickly identified the poser among the suspects.
meanings.sent5: The poser's disguise was so obvious that no one believed his lies.

meanings.sent1: The math test had a poser that stumped many students.
meanings.sent2: Solving that poser required a lot of critical thinking.
meanings.sent3: The poser on the quiz was so tricky that even the teacher got it wrong.
meanings.sent4: The poser in the riddle left everyone scratching their heads.
meanings.sent5: The poser in the crossword puzzle was the last one to be solved.

meanings.definition: A person who poses for a photograph or painting.
meanings.sent1: The model was a professional poser and knew how to strike the perfect pose.
meanings.sent2: The artist asked the poser to hold the pose for a few more minutes.
meanings.sent3: The poser in the portrait had a hard time keeping a serious expression.
meanings.sent4: The poser's stillness made it easy for the artist to capture every detail.
meanings.sent5: The poser's smile lit up the entire photograph.
